page.title: 14FELTWELL PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: The Parish Council is elected every three years. We have thirteen councillors in all. Eleven represent Feltwell Ward and two represent Anchor Ward. The council is elected to represent the people of Feltwell, to administer all business in the very best interest of the parish as a whole. Many different topics are discussed each month. The regular issues that come up concern planning applications. The Parish Council make their observations known to the West Norfolk Borough Council and they decide whether it's to be approved or refused. Another item that is regularly discussed is the condition of the highways. We have to report pot holes, flooding, bad pathways and road signs. Norfolk County Council are responsible for cutting grass verges, especially the corners of side roads.
